meanings.sent1: The dissocial cat preferred to nap alone rather than play with other pets.
meanings.sent2: She found it hard to make friends because of her dissocial nature.
meanings.sent3: The dissocial penguin decided to skip the group swim and waddled off on its own.
meanings.sent4: His dissocial behavior was like a dark cloud that kept others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The dissocial student always sat by themselves, avoiding group activities.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of interest in social activities
meanings.sent1: The dissocial teenager spent hours in their room, avoiding family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: Her dissocial behavior made her seem unapproachable to her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The dissocial squirrel chose to hoard nuts alone rather than join the group.
meanings.sent4: His dissocial tendencies were like a barrier between him and his peers.
meanings.sent5: The dissocial employee always ate lunch alone, away from the rest of the team.

meanings.definition: Opposed to or avoiding social interaction
meanings.sent1: The dissocial individual declined all party invitations, preferring solitude.
meanings.sent2: His dissocial attitude made it challenging for him to collaborate with others.
meanings.sent3: The dissocial butterfly fluttered away from the rest of the swarm, seeking solitude.
meanings.sent4: Her dissocial behavior was like a shield protecting her from unwanted interactions.
meanings.sent5: The dissocial artist worked in seclusion, away from the bustling art community.
